dxf2svg.util
Class TableLayer

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.TableLayer
public final class TableLayer
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an encapsulation of DXF layer tables. These tables are stored in java.util.HashMaps and referenced in style sheets by the StyleSheetGenerator object.

Version:
1.6 - September 15, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Field Detail

lang1NoteLayerName

protected static java.lang.String lang1NoteLayerName
These values are the names of language layers from the DXF file. lang1 is english lang2 is french the default layer name is 't'. All these values can be set dynamically from the command line with the switch '-english_note_layer_name', '-french_note_layer_name' and finally '-default_target_english_note_layer_name' and '-default_target_french_note_layer_name'. What ever the layers are called, they will be switched to the 'english' and 'french' layers if they exist and if they don't then they are placed on the defaultNoteLayerName.

lang2NoteLayerName

protected static java.lang.String lang2NoteLayerName

TableLayer

Method Detail

setNoteLayerName

public static void setNoteLayerName(int language,
                                    java.lang.String name)
Allows a client to set note layer names. The default is lang1NoteLayerName for English and lang2NoteLayerName for French. see setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String) for information about setting the default layer name. This is required in the case that the graphic is a bilingual illustration i.e. it contains two languages that are both visible all the time. If this is the case it is not possible to move the objects to the 'english' or 'french' layer because they do not exist. In this case the instruction will be to move items on these layers to setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String).

See Also:
setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String), setLanguageLayerName(int, String)

getNoteLayerName

public static java.lang.String getNoteLayerName(int language)
Returns the name of the layer that notes can be found on predicated on the argument language type.

getLanguageLayerName

public static java.lang.String getLanguageLayerName(int language)
Returns the name of a language layer predicated on the argument language type.

getDefaultLanguageLayerName

public static java.lang.String getDefaultLanguageLayerName()
Returns the name of the default langugage layer name. The default is layer 't' on Spar illustrations. The return name is normalized to CSS standards (odd characters are translated to standard CSS naming convensions.)

setLanguageLayerName

public static void setLanguageLayerName(int language,
                                        java.lang.String name)
Allows the client to specify the name of the layer that the notes should be moved to. In the case where notes appear on the default 'noteseng'; once the notes have been processed the text should be moved to the 'english' layer so they can participate with standard language processing (switching of languages etc.)

See Also:
setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String), setNoteLayerName(int, java.lang.String)

setDefaultLanguageLayerName

public static void setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the default target note layer name; that is if the language target layer name doesn't exist then we cover by setting the value to the defaultLangLayerName.

See Also:
setLanguageLayerName(int, java.lang.String), setNoteLayerName(int, java.lang.String)

setNoteNumberLayerName

public static void setNoteNumberLayerName(java.lang.String name)
This method allows the user to specify the name of the layer that note numbers can be found on. The default is 'notenums'. There is no method that changes the target layer name of the note numbers as it is assumed that the index numbers are not translated and therefore get placed on the default text layer specified with setDefaultLanguageLayerName(java.lang.String).

getNoteNumberLayerName

public static java.lang.String getNoteNumberLayerName()
Returns the name of the layer that the note numbers appears on (default noteNumbersLayerName).

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the layer, also removes spaces and for consistance places all characters into lower case in preparation to be used as class names.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns name of layer. Used to fetch an TableLayer object from a hashmap using the name as a key.

setLineTypeName

public void setLineTypeName(java.lang.String ltname)
Sets the line type for this layer.

getLineTypeName

public java.lang.String getLineTypeName()
Returns the line type for this layer.

setColour

public void setColour(int colour)
Sets the layer's colour.

Parameters:
colour - Acad colour number as an integer.

setLayerVisible

public void setLayerVisible(int test)
Sets the locked or frozen switch for this layer.
  • 1 = Layer is frozen; otherwise layer is thawed.
  • 2 = Layer is frozen by default in new viewports.
  • 4 = Layer is locked.

getLayerVisible

public boolean getLayerVisible()
Reports whether this layer is locked or frozen

getColour

public int getColour()
Returns this layer's colour as an Acad colour number.

Returns:
Colour as an integer. This is the colour number directly from the DXF. The colour of a layer can be over- ridden with the '-c' switch. This will coerce the colour to a predefined value.

setLineWeight

public void setLineWeight(double w)
Sets the line weight for the layer. This is primarily information gleened from CustomLayerStyle.

setFill

public void setFill(int fill)
Used to set the fill of a layer.

Parameters:
fill - The integer colour value of the fill. Refer to an AutoCAD colour chart for valid values.

getFill

public int getFill()
Returns the integer value of the fill for this layer if set. If it is not set the current layer colour is returned.

updateLayer

public void updateLayer(CustomLayerStyle customLayerStyle)
This method takes a custom layer style passed from the config.d2s file via the StyleSheetGenerator and updates the layers settings based on those custom settings.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the sumation of the layer's data (line type, colour) in a String format for incorporation into stylesheets.
